reviews.review: Great movie, but worst ending since the invention of theater.
Excellent movie, it had its issues, but the best so far after the original avengers movie.

The best cinematic experience i've had in my life. The film is phenomenal. If you're a true comic book and comic book movie fan, especially a Marvel/MCU fan, this movie is everything you've ever wanted.

An awesome achievement in both the macro of its grand vistas and set-pieces, and the micro of the delightful and often-poignant character-work...and in the fact that, despite its length and number of characters, it manages to be enthralling until the VERY end! Don't miss it!!!
Great movie, star wars should take some notes

It's hard to rate it now since we have to wait a year to see how it wraps up I thought it was great.  I hate CGI, even done well but Thanos didn't bother me.  It was really fun to see different characters who've never shared the screen now interact with one another.  I can't wait to see pt 4 next year.

And don't let all of the DC fanboy low scores dissuade you from seeing it; they're still bitter about being 1 for their last 4.
the runtime Should have been shorter...
Internally inconsistent, painfully long, and boring.
It might not change your life but it will pass two and a half hours quite comfortably.

***** SPOILER ALERT ***** - Avengers Infinity Wars part one Not bad as far as Part Ones go but still has your head twirling because it’s jam packed with Marvel heroes and star power. Of course, CGI Thanos rules the screen and even manifests sympathy for himself. SPOILER ALERT: Why if Dr Strange has the time stone could he not reverse time to better combat Thanos’ first two children? Why could he not reverse time to get the glove off? Why the red herrings by way of superheroes dying was not believable? When did Wanda and Vision start a romance? Why could not Vision with the most powerful stone obliterate Thanos? Yeah yeah I know they had to make the drama move along and sacrifice marvel universe logic for there to be a story to the film but seriously you can’t assume your audience won’t know or understand its Avengers universe lore.
